column4: So when I log into my desktop its all a white screen with a cursor.  My cursor will change depending on what it is over, but I can't see anything.  I tried "sudo aptitude dist-upgrade" on a command line (crtl alt F1) and it upgraded, but my screen is still white.  Should I try recovery mode?
and when I restart I can see my desktop flash by, but only for a second

So when I log into my desktop its all a white screen with a cursor.  My cursor will change depending on what it is over, but I can't see anything.  I tried "sudo aptitude dist-upgrade" on a command line (crtl alt F1) and it upgraded, but my screen is still white.  When I restart my desktop as normal flashes by as it all shuts down.  Should I try recovery mode?
sounds like a problem with gdm, check /etc/logs
